meanings.definition: Offers or proposals made in response to a request.
meanings.sent1: The company received many tenders for the construction project.
meanings.sent2: The tenders submitted for the job varied in price and quality.
meanings.sent3: The tenders for the catering service were so delicious, they made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her tenders for friendship were always welcomed with open arms.
meanings.sent5: The tenders for the painting job were as colorful as a rainbow.

meanings.sent1: She had a tender touch when caring for the injured bird.
meanings.sent2: The puppy's tender eyes melted everyone's hearts.
meanings.sent3: The tender hug from her grandmother was the best feeling in the world.
meanings.sent4: His tender words reassured her during difficult times.
meanings.sent5: The tender care of the nurse made the patient feel safe and comforted.

meanings.definition: A person who tends to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The tender of the garden knew each plant by name.
meanings.sent2: The tender of the horses made sure they were well-fed and groomed.
meanings.sent3: The tender of the library always had a book recommendation ready.
meanings.sent4: She was the tender of the children, always watching over them with care.
meanings.sent5: The tender of the museum guided visitors with knowledge and enthusiasm.
